storyInfo: Dublinn's 'Leader' executes the girl who leaked word of the meeting.

attributes.content: Leader, we've found them.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Good. Bring them forth.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: What are you doing?! Le—Let go of me!
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: It was you who tipped off the Victorian Army about the meeting?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: What? How do you know...
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Wait a moment, you—you're... it's you?! You're the one the chief editor was talking about...
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: You're going to bring about a war, lead us to throw off our oppressors, just like they said?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: No... you'll bring death... turn our homeland to ruins, just like you're doing now.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: The source of it all, everything, it was you!
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: What I will bring is victory only.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: And you, Saoirse Kelly, have deeply harmed our people's trust in you.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Because of your duplicity, many honest men have fallen into enemy prisons, and due to your betrayal, countless fighters have lost their chance to ever see the glory of victory.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: You must pay the price for your actions.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Did they... really die because of what I did?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Last night, all those gathering in that room, a huge amount of them sincerely wanted to welcome you—they believed you would bring us good change!
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: And now, they've been blown apart, scorched to earth, just like this street. Is it really me—who lit this fire?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Shut your mouth, traitor!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: You feeble, weak defector! How can you understand a martyr's resolve? Rather than fall into enemy hands, suffer humiliation and torment, they rathered they would welcome The Leader's fire with heads high!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: For the welfare of the Tarans, they had no choice but to sacrifice themselves in the flames of war!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Sentence her, Leader, give her the death penalty!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: The death penalty?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Of course. Don't you see? Only the deaths of traitors can calm the rage of the warriors.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Besides—look at the locals. They want to come closer, but don't dare. They fear us, fear you. This is the chance to make them submit.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Once you put this traitor to death, then they'll learn, nobody betrays Dublinn and lives.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Betrayal... hmm?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Saoirse Kelly, have you ever pondered the consequences of betrayal?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: I... maybe, I'll die.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: But I've no regrets. You'd have me dead for wanting to save my family and friends, and that only proves I did the right thing—if no one else stops you, even more blood will stain your hands.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: You are... courageous.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: I didn't mishear, did I? You praise a traitor for courage?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: She is one of our fellows too.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: She wasn't any longer, ever since she chose to stand in the way.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: What's the point of prattling about this, really? If I was her, I wouldn't be asking so much. Words from the condemned should have no effect on you.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: What if... it were my sister?
They're all asking it.
And yet... I don't like thinking like this. I—never liked it.
Do it, now!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You've got all these eyes on you. The longer you delay, the weaker we look. Who wants to follow a weak leader? How could the people follow a weak army?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: She didn't give me a choice.
This child isn't the first of our fellows I've killed. How young was I then? She had me burn the Victorian merchant who wouldn't sell us bread, to death.
I forget how I did it. I shut my eyes and lifted a knife, yet stabbed into only a pile of acrid ashes.
And after, more and more ashes came. Just like this child, the braver, the faster they burn.
Saoirse Kelly... In my name as the Leader of Dublinn, I sentence you to death.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: I will carry out the execution personally, right here.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Seems... I'm going to die after all.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Leader... You're The Leader. Probably no one could stop you, and probably my whole family will die too. But can you tell me? Will we win?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Will we reach the day, when us Tarans can all live a better life?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: We will.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Good, that's good. At least at this moment, I'm willing to... believe.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Do you have anything else to say?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Fire... I saw the fire from the tip of your lance. Will it hurt badly when I'm burned alive?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: No... don't tell me, after all. I can't bear to hear.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: I ask of you, tell my ma and my da, if they can still live after everything's over...
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: I've hidden from them, some money in the third drawer by my bed. I wanted to buy my ma a bouquet of flowers for her birthday, next month...
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Tell them, I'm sorry, everyone.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: I promise you.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: *Whimper*... I don't want to die. I'm scared...
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Ah... hah... maybe next spring, in the burned soil, a willow might sprout...
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: For... Dublinn!
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: I've said these words... countless times.
Every time I do, my chest stirs in burning pain, as if the spear wasn't in my hands, but stabbed into my body.
Again and again I tell myself, life burns easily, and they are all fuel.
And I'm no exception.
Hah, she's dead. That's decent enough.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Give the order, make everyone else know, the traitor's been executed.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: The next one wants to go informing, they'll be waiting to crumble to charcoal like her.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: As for you, what's wrong with you today?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Dragging your heels so hard, the soldiers saw. Even thought their Leader would be soft on traitors.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Hey, you can't really be turning soft, can you?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: It's one girl! You and your fire burned most of the street in a snap yesterday!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Here I thought you finally seemed the part a bit, 'Leader.'
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Do I seem the part?
Seem what part? I haven't been able to tell what I seem for a long time.
Ever since I was little, I've only seen her appearance, her speech, her fire.
She had me become this way too. I couldn't do it, so I was bound to hide under her fire's light.
She's a million miles off again.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Every time I see her looking like that, I just want to get up in her face and scream.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Jealous, now?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Don't give me shit. I just can't stomach seeing the face she puts on. Must be nothing but drainwater soap bubbles in that head.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Why'd The Leader put her in this position?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: If it weren't for the face she was born with, she'd be a waste of space. Can't even execute a traitor properly.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: So you did it for her.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: She hasn't the capacity to tell herself, but I saw it as quite obvious. Before her fire caught, an unseeable rock had already bored through the girl's chest.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I just couldn't hold on!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: All because of this shameless traitor. I broke my back gathering all those rich and powerful supporters, and you know what? Dead. Dust to dust. Farewell.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Oh? I didn't think you had even a lick of the pitying type in you.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Ha... even a bunch of meatbeasts would show some use before they died, right? Well done, now, you, well done! Turned to coke with a bump.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Good enough, perhaps, that they died so simply. Don't forget, that little greedy plan of yours nearly buried us all deep, deep under.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I... I did it for The Leader, and Dublinn!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You can't tell me you don't think she's unsuited. Even if she didn't bring all the people, I could've handled County Hillock fine. No, even better. I could've done even better.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: If The Leader could just trust me some more...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Unsuited? Well, I won't say you're not right.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: People, well, they're best off understanding, after all, not to yearn day in and day out about clambering up where they don't belong. Or else, you know, they miss one tiny thing, trip and fall all the la-dee-da way down... bang, and it's flesh and bones everywhere.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Are you getting on my case?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: How could I be?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Let's go. You're just pissing yourself off staring at her. We still have to discuss the next step.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: 'The Bandit,' 'The Immolator,' 'The Accountant,' 'The Toxicologist,' 'The Convict,' and 'The Elocutionist.' We sent the notice out yesterday, so gauging the time, they should all have arrived.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The city hall's ours now, and we've got quite a few VIPs and nobility under control too. But it's still not enough. We need to have County Hillock totally occupied before The Leader gets here.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: ...Nrgh.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Keep biting, and you'll clean your nail off before you know it.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Much bloody appreciated.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: When it happens, don't you come begging me in tears to paint you a new design.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: When've I ever cried in front of you?!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I just don't like letting the credit go to others.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Alright, alright, you think I don't know you? You were one of the first to start following The Leader. You ought to set your sights a bit farther some. But one single Hillock, and you're in this frenzy of a state. You don't even think it's embarrassing.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Once things are all done here, The Leader needs someone to run a trip to Londinium in her stead.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Say that sooner! Quick, let's get going, I need County Hillock won within half a day!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Each one of them has their own greed inside, wild and wondrously formed, and not even the fiercest fire could burn them all through.
So what about mine? I only want to—hide...
Yet, does a shadow have the right to flee?
Leader.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Madam Harmonie's inviting you to hold the meeting.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Do I... have to go?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Er, Madam did say, if you really don't want to go, they can respect your wishes.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Respect...? How kind of her.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Soldier, go and tell them, carry it all out according to plan.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: They know their own duty. They don't need me pushing them.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: As for me, I need to think in peace. Order your people to keep proper watch, and let nobody disturb me.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: Yes, Leader.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: I need... a little time...
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: What... is this?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: In the ruins of the village, I found a piece of paper.
It was fragile, very much so, all four corners charred black, and as I picked it up, half fell to ash, and sadly, only half of the words were left upon it.
'Why should I lose heart'
'A great flame may have burned the whole land to its end'
'But I see someone's soul, on the other side of the scales'
It was a poem, a verse missing its beginning.
These words seemed freshly written, the ink still not naturally set, before fire scorched it dry.
Yes. My fire.
My soul...
